title: Heap and Priority Queue Quiz
description: Test heap invariants, top-k strategy, and complexity choices.

questions.question: Which statement about heaps is correct?
options: Only root has guaranteed extreme priority
questions.explanation: Heap guarantees parent-child order, not full ordering.

questions.question: For top-k largest values, a common strategy is:
questions.explanation: Min-heap root tracks smallest among current top-k candidates.

questions.question: Why is top-k via heap often O(n log k)?
options: All n items are sorted fully
Each of n items may trigger O(log k) heap adjustment
questions.explanation: Bounded heap operations scale with k rather than n.

questions.question: Heap top peek complexity is typically:
A common heap bug with objects is:
options: Missing explicit comparator by priority field
questions.explanation: Without comparator rules, object ordering may be incorrect.
